attributes.comment:
Please consider the impact of raising biometrics and immigration benefit
application fees to those families who are trying to adopt children from foreign
countries in addition to the many adult immigrants who must get fingerprinted
more frequently now due to homeland security policy changes.

Adoption fees are already expensive and prohibitive to many wonderful families
who would like to share America's relatively great wealth and benefits to children
in developing nations who have far fewer opportunities than Americans do. Even
the poorest families in the US have much higher standards of living than children
in developing nations. Adopting abandoned and orphaned children into American
families is only a small fulfillment of our obligation to these nations, many for
which our foreign policies and exploitative business practices have fostered
conditions of poverty.

Therefore, please do not further penalize the children and adults of these nations
by creating more economic hardship for those trying to offer them a second
chance.

Sincerely,

Shellie Ellis
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Shellie Ellis
